alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 8:11PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT YAVAPAI COUNTY THROUGH 900 PM MST... At 811 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dewey-humboldt to Ponderosa Park. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prescott Valley, Prescott, Dewey-humboldt, Groom Creek Subdivision, Prescott Airport, Walker, Poland Junction, Prescott Gateway Mall, Iron Springs, Yavapai County Fairgrounds, Yavapai Campground, Downtown Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Indian Hill West Prescott, Oak Knoll Village, Lower Wolf Creek Campground, Mingus Mountain Campground, Playground Group Campground, Potato Patch Campground, and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 300 and 320. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 337. State Route 69 between mile markers 276 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
